coreCitation.title: Simplified Massachusetts Town Boundaries
coreCitation.shortDescription: This layer, acquired from MassGIS, is the most accurate representation of Massachusetts' municipal (city and town) boundaries. Short desc note from @garrett on how it has been improved

temporal.temporalNotes: The content of this metadata record reflects processing that was undertaken on the most recently available data at the time.

resourceConstellation.accessCondition: This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use.

entryPoints.title: Massachusetts Towns Simplified GeoJSON
entryPoints.notes: This dataset is the final result of the LMEC processing performed upon the original MassGIS towns file. Use in conjunction with the MassGIS metadata record, to compare with original data or make sense of the attribute fields

entryPoints.title: MassGIS Data: Community Boundaries (Towns) from Survey Points
entryPoints.notes: This is the data record for the original, pre-processed dataset made available via MassGIS

codebooks.title: MassGIS Data: Community Boundaries (Towns) from Survey Points

imageFiles.title: Before simplifiying
imageFiles.caption: Here @garrett, you could conceivably do before/after pics to demostrate the purpose of simplifying.

imageFiles.title: After simplifiying

missingInformation.missingContextNotes: No context was left blank due to unknowns.
missingInformation.missingDataNotes: There are no known missing values in the data, unless @garrett you want to fill in some information here.

officialMaintenance.maintenanceFrequency: This data is updated frequently, roughly once a year, at no regular interval. Maintenance notes with all versions can be found in the codebook.

archivingAndMaintenance.preferredCitation: @garrett, what format do you think we should go with here
